title: Your most hated champ?
body:
If you are playing league and you do not want to murder someone by the end of the match, then you are either a new player, a pacifist or a liar.

The tittle says it all. Just say which champ(s) is the one you hate the most. For me: - 
**Top**: {{champion:122}} He is the reason why I don't play top. The BS heal and the frickin ult is too much for me.

**Jungle**: {{champion:35}} Picture this. You are a Katarina against a Veigar. You bait his 'E' then go full on ham on him. He still has his ult but you some how outplay him. And manage to kill him with just 5% of HP left. Satisfied, you are about to go back. When suddenly you are ignited and get shived. Before you know what is going on you are dead. When you look at you kill feed, it's {{champion:35}} like a serial killer he is.

**Mid**: - {{champion:105}} The 'E' ability

**Support**: - {{champion:53}} The fckin hook. As soon as he hooks you, you are dead.

**ADC**: -{{champion:67}}. 1v5. Need I say more. The only ADC that can 1v1 her is Draven. Other wise she will completely shred your 500 Stacks Nasus or your tankiest Rammus. It does not matter at all.

With all that being said, the champ that I hate the most is {{champion:157}} . Not because of his flashy as ***k abilities or his angsty dialogues. But its the player who make me hate him. Not because they are toxic. After all, Riven, Udyr and many other players are notorious for being toxic as well. Not because they like to spam their dashes like a madman esp. when I play mid. But it's because they are unreliable. You don't know whether the Yasuo on your team is going to feed or carry like a boss. Whenever I have a Yasuo player on my team, the result has always been a loss with a few rare wins. But the Yasuo on the other team is a frickin god.




P.S. This is not a generalization. Just something for fun. Every champ requires is easy to learn but hard to master. And we are human beings so obviously we are far from being perfect. I doubt every toxic player is a jerk in real life. Just the heat of the game gets to them

I'm torn between two. They're equally annoying. One for a reason I believe actually holds water. One because they're just so goddamned annoying.

{{champion:114}} **Fiora**: One word. **AD-scaling-percentage-max-HP-damage-on-vital-hit.**
*(That is one word, I swear. It's hyphenated and everything.)*
There is literally no way to build against it. You build resistances? It ignores them. You build more health? It does more damage. Yes, she's meant to be a duelist, and good in 1v1 situations, but those numbers can get very silly.

{{champion:245}} **Ekko**: Ekko.

{{champion:64}} Not even a question. Allowed and enforced to completely kill any and all jungle variety for years. And the moment the jungle meta shifts away from "Lee and champions who can deal with Lee" either he immediately gets buffed or champions who took over the spotlight get (over)nerfed.

D'uh, excuse me, have you seen Sonic Wave/ Resonating Strike, idiot? Skill-shots of long range are hard, and therefore Lee Sin is "the hardest jungler to play" because skill-shots are exclusive to Lee Sin, now if you'll excuse me I have to take a sip with my guaranteed self-shield turned to lifesteal and (spell-vamp is still in the game on Lee Sin, amazing.) Keep in mind one of the two champions that still gets away with ward hopping. On pre-rework Katarina it was acknowledged to be discouraging to play against, but too many people have convinced themselves that Lee Sin's kit is iconic which somehow keeps anyone from recognizing it's a fucking problem.

Annie!!! There are a lot of champs I hate (Darius, Fiora, Yasuo, Blitz,...) but they all have some counterplay to their kit... Annie however...a free stun that she can hold on to forever until she sees an opportunity to use her undodgable point and click spell on you, stuns you and than deletes you from the game... I am so glad she has a low pickrate right now!

Champions i dislike playing against.   {{champion:131}}  she is a fighter, tank, mage, and assassin all in one kit, making her really annoying to deal with.
Yasuo {{champion:157}}  windwall that can block ultimates... enough said.
Karma {{champion:43}} you think you killed her then she just uses her ult W and she is back to full health.
Vayne {{champion:67}}  i just hate max health % true dmg, as a tank only thing you can do is buy frozen heart to slow down being shredded so fast, but really nothing you can build to protect you.
Fiora {{champion:114}} same as vayne, i hate max health % true dmg because there is literally. Nothing you can build to counter max health % true dmg, just hope to kill them before they kill you. Fiora does take skill to play her, just playing against a good fiora you see how broken her max health % true dmg is

you can build sustain to counter max hp true damage 

like lifesteal and such
Yes let me go full lifesteal on Malphite. The tanks are the onest that can do the least against it, and they are the ones getting hit the hardest.
It should be as long as its conditional and/or not easy to apply.

First, it does have counterplay and build. Backing off from Vayne during trades prevents her from getting one more more full W procs. And building attack speed slows how many full W procs she can get. Even Fiora can be positioned.

Second, it does have a place in the game as a very niche sort of damage. Because Vayne has %max hp damage which is very rare, she will have a place in the game, small or big, unless she is dumpstered. Similar to how Ziggs being the seige mage will keep him from being overshadowed by other artillery mages like Lux. 

And yes. %HP magic and physical isn't always enough.

First, you ignored the counterbuilding part.

> Backing off from vayne? Good thing she doesn't have a movement speed steroid when she's chasing an enemy.. Oh wait..

Good thing there is CC, mobility, AND utility abilities such as Anivia wall to keep her away before she gets a/another true damage proc.

> "Don't get near her" it's not counterplay.

It sure isn't counterplay. Backing off before she can get 3 autos off is though. Its not that hard to auto>Q and walk away as someone like Varus.

{{champion:53}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:115}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:27}} {{champion:24}}{{champion:17}} 

In no particular order, these are the champions I absolutely hate. There's I haven't listed though. Like anyone with who has high damage, stuns and invulnerabilities is super annoying to me, cause I just think that kind of kit shouldn't exist. And to be honest, I probably hate most champs.

> [{quoted}](name=Eternal791,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bxzxAtE0,comment-id=001b,timestamp=2017-03-11T17:11:13.593+0000)
>

> Like anyone with who has high damage, stuns and invulnerabilities is super annoying to me, cause I just think that kind of kit shouldn't exist. 

Sona has none of these things.  She has the lowest damage output of all supports and is literally the squishiest character in the entire game.  Her only hard CC is post-6(literally the only support champ in the game w/o pre-6 CC) and it's one of the weakest stuns in this entire game.  Its duration, hitbox and cooldown are all complete shit.

Not everyone on that list is annoying to me cause they have stuns, high damage, and invulnerability. However Sona can actually deal a lot of damage that's kinda hard to avoid. I've 2v1'd a sona before and lost because not only did she heal a ton, but she dealt more damage than me and my support combined.

Sona does NOT do damage, she has the lowest bases and scalings of all supports.  However, as a direct result of this, she builds ARTIFICIAL damage, usually in the form of Spellblade and Echo, which actually do do damage.

After that, Sona is also the worst healer in the game, but even with Windspeaker's and any of the several Windspeaker items, her minuscule heals can stave off a basic attack, which many fights are determined by just 1 basic attack.

You did not lose to a Sona, that's literally a mathematic impossibility.  What you actually lost to were artificial stats created by OP items while your team was already 10k gold behind.  A Nami could've 3v1'd with the exact same setup, cause Nami actually has usable numbers on her own even before adding in artificial ones on top.

> [{quoted}](name=Eternal791,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bxzxAtE0,comment-id=001b,timestamp=2017-03-11T17:11:13.593+0000)
>
> {{champion:53}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:115}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:27}} {{champion:24}}{{champion:17}} 
> 
> Like anyone with who has high damage, stuns and invulnerabilities is super annoying to me, cause I just think that kind of kit shouldn't exist.

Wait who has a kit with high damage, stuns, AND invulnerability?

**EDIT:** Wait a minute, must be {{champion:432}} duh, he deals more damage than {{champion:11}} , has more CC than {{champion:127}} , and can make baron and dragon go invulnerable... so op.
45% winrate and he is op ??
hes wonrate iz 101% thas how op he iz

{{champion:67}}  every time they're on my team, 0/8 39cs after 12mins.

every time they're on the enemy team they play like gosu.

Top : {{champion:48}} No matter the matchup, I always seem to lose to this guy. Shen? Riven? Nothing tends to work. A close second is {{champion:85}}. I struggle against him far more than I feel I should, again no matter the matchup. 

Jungle : Gotta be {{champion:104}}. The only jungler that for some reason can't ever seem to punish. I can avoid him easy enough, but he just manages to punish me for trying to punish him when he makes a clear mistake, so I just learned to steer clear until I'm sure I'm way more fed than he is. 

Mid : {{champion:55}} Don't get me wrong, I have a hard time actually losing to a Kat in lane. However, after the laning phase ends, my team always seems to get Quadra'ed (or penta'ed if she got that fed) by her mid to late game. I'm then forced to leave base just to kill her and immediately return back because she undoubtedly tore at least 80% of my health off and it gets damn annoying. I don't even need to go though that much effort to kill a well protected ADC. 

Bot and Support are more or less Peeve free. I don't play either role enough to interact with anyone enough to make a judgment call like who do I hate, and I don't typically struggle against any support or ADC particularly more than another.
I remembered another:{{champion:37}} . What is the range on her Q activation? 1500 yards?

It's 700 units.  That's only 50 more than Caitlyn's base attack range, 25 less than Nami's W and about 300+ less than: Blitz' Q, Thresh' Q, Morg's Q and pretty much almost every support.  Sona has one of the shortest ranges amongst all supports in general, not even just mage supports.  Fuck, her bubbles are only 400 units, they barely even count as "ranged" matching only Graves' and Mini-Gnar's ranges for the lowest range in the entire fucking game.  Hell, since the bubbles are spells, even that's not a fair comparison since every support ranged spells' ranges are a minimum of 500+ EXCEPT for Sona.

Sona is literally the shortest-range support in League, in complete contradiction to the fact she's also the squishiest character in this game.
